summary: NASA is developing 3 closely related systems—the Orion crew vehicle, Space Launch System, and Exploration Ground Systems—to put astronauts into space. Since our last report , NASA's launch of Artemis I—the first uncrewed test flight involving these 3 systems—was again delayed, this time due in part to manufacturing challenges. The new date, November 2021, doesn't take into account any COVID-19 delays. NASA is awarding billions...
title: NASA Human Space Exploration: Significant Investments in Future Capabilities Require Strengthened Management Oversight
